howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Explore the technology stack and architecture behind ChainElect

techStack.title: Technology Stack
techStack.intro: Our system leverages industry-leading technologies to deliver a secure, transparent, and user-friendly voting experience.

react.title: React
react.description: Frontend UI library for building interactive components

polygon.title: Polygon
polygon.description: Blockchain network for secure, transparent voting

solidity.title: Solidity
solidity.description: Smart contract language for vote logic and security

nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.description: Backend runtime environment for API services

architecture.title: System Architecture
architecture.intro: Our multi-layered architecture ensures security, performance, and reliability.

frontend.title: Frontend Layer
frontend.description: The user interface is built with React and Vite for fast performance. We use modern React patterns including hooks and context API for state management. The UI communicates with both the backend server and directly with the blockchain via Web3.js.

blockchain.title: Blockchain Layer
blockchain.description: Our smart contracts are written in Solidity and deployed on the Polygon network. The contracts handle the core voting logic, ensuring each vote is securely recorded, cannot be tampered with, and is transparent for verification.

backend.title: Backend Layer
backend.description: A Node.js server handles user authentication, profile management, and serves as a bridge between the frontend and database. Supabase provides database capabilities and file storage for voter profile images.

security.title: Security Layer
security.description: Multiple security mechanisms are in place: MetaMask wallet verification ensures one-vote-per-person, email verification confirms user identity, and Face API provides an additional layer of verification during the voting process.

workflow.title: Voting Workflow
workflow.intro: From registration to results, our streamlined process ensures a smooth voting experience.

step1.title: Registration
step1.description: Users register with their email, create a password, and connect their MetaMask wallet. Profile images are stored securely in Supabase.

step2.title: Authentication
step2.description: Secure login using email/password, with MetaMask wallet verification to prevent duplicate voting.

step3.title: Candidate Selection
step3.description: Users see available candidates with information and select their preferred choice.

step4.title: Blockchain Verification
step4.description: The vote is verified and recorded on the Polygon blockchain, requiring confirmation via MetaMask.

step5.title: Vote Confirmation
step5.description: Users receive confirmation of their vote with a transaction hash for verification.

step6.title: Results Viewing
step6.description: Once the election ends, results are tallied from the blockchain and displayed with interactive charts.

benefits.title: Key Benefits
benefits.intro: ChainElect offers numerous advantages over traditional voting systems.

immutability.title: Immutability
immutability.description: Once recorded on the blockchain, votes cannot be altered or deleted.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: All transactions are publicly verifiable while maintaining voter privacy.

security.title: Security
security.description: Multi-layer security with cryptographic voting mechanisms.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Vote from anywhere with internet access and a supported browser.
